result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Hedges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
New probation case form.  Ineligible voting notice & acknowledgement.  Notice of right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Michael W. Hedges in court with attorney Karl J Kelz.  Kurt B Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty. Deft enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 in 13CF272 and Count 2 in 14CF70.  Remainings counts from both cases are dismissed and read in.

13CF272:
24 month probation w/held, AODA assessment and treatment and followup,  Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.   Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  14 days jail w/huber court is allowing the deft to serve the jail in seven(7) days increments the first seven days on or before 7/18/14 @ 9:00 am the second seven days on or before 9/19/14 @ 9:00 am, 40 hours community service involuing speaking to groups regarding  drugs

14CF70:
24 months probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.
Status conference on June 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
filed - reading waived.  ARGN: Not guilty pleas entered.
